meanings.definition: Shikras: a type of small, agile bird of prey
meanings.sent1: The shikras swiftly swooped down to catch their prey.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of shikras soaring high in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The shikras decided to have a race to see who could catch the most food.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were as sharp as a shikras' when it came to spotting movement.
meanings.sent5: The shikras' hunting skills were unmatched in the forest.

meanings.definition: Shikras: the plural form of the word 'shikra', referring to multiple birds of prey of this species.
meanings.sent1: We observed a flock of shikras perched on the branches.
meanings.sent2: The shikras in the sanctuary were well-cared for by the staff.
meanings.sent3: The shikras held a meeting to discuss their next hunting strategy.
meanings.sent4: The sky was filled with the silhouettes of shikras as they flew back to their nests.
meanings.sent5: The shikras' feathers glistened in the sunlight as they glided through the air.
